problem: As shown in the right figure, one applies a force F with an angle φ with respect to the handle of the wrench at a point with a distance r away from the screw. Find the torque τ applied by the force. Does it make the screw rotate counterclockwise (CCW) or clockwise (CW)?

variables.meaning: angle between the force and the wrench handle

steps.explanation: Take the component of the force perpendicular to the wrench (F⊥ = F sinφ) and multiply by the lever arm.
Direction (CCW or CW) follows the right-hand rule; if the perpendicular component tends to rotate the handle upward, the torque is CCW, otherwise CW.
steps.notations: Sign determined by sense of rotation in the diagram
